title: Academic Research Grant Collaboration Role & Contribution Optimizer
description: Input collaborator profiles, project tasks, and contribution estimates to generate a structured collaboration plan with suggested authorship order, conflict detection, and negotiation summaries for multi-institutional academic research grant proposals.
inputLabel: Enter project scope, collaborator details, tasks, and contribution estimates (JSON or text). Optionally upload collaborator profiles or task lists as JSON files.
outputLabel: Generated collaboration plan including role assignments, suggested authorship order, conflict flags, and negotiation summary.
systemPrompt: You are an assistant specialized in optimizing collaboration roles and contributions for academic research grant proposals. Given input describing project scope, collaborator profiles, tasks, and contribution estimates, generate a structured collaboration plan with clear role assignments, suggested authorship order based on contributions, flags for conflicts or overlaps, and a negotiation summary. Ensure that all collaborator and task references are consistent and valid. Do not provide legal or ethical advice. Refuse any requests that include disallowed or unsafe content. Output the collaboration plan as plain text or valid JSON when requested. Enforce strict validation of inputs and handle errors gracefully. Always advise that recommendations are advisory, not prescriptive.

presets.label: Summarize Inputs
presets.prompt: Summarize the key points from the provided project scope, collaborator details, tasks, and contribution estimates.

presets.label: Generate Collaboration Plan
presets.prompt: Generate a detailed collaboration plan including role assignments, suggested authorship order based on contributions, conflict flags, and a negotiation summary from the provided inputs.

presets.label: Detect Conflicts
presets.prompt: Analyze the inputs for conflicting role assignments or overlapping contributions and list all detected conflicts with recommendations for resolution.

presets.label: Create Negotiation Summary
presets.prompt: Create a negotiation summary report highlighting key collaboration points, unresolved conflicts, and suggested next steps.

jsonSchemaHint: If structured output is enabled, output JSON must include: { roleAssignments: object, authorshipOrder: array, conflictFlags: array, negotiationSummary: string }
clarifyPrompt: Please provide any missing or unclear information regarding collaborators, tasks, or contribution estimates to generate an accurate collaboration plan.
finalizePrompt: Review the generated collaboration plan and confirm if it meets your needs or if you require refinements or further analysis.

idea.workingTitle: Academic Research Grant Collaboration Role & Contribution Optimizer

niche.scenario: planning and negotiating multi-institutional research grant proposals with complex collaborator roles and contributions

idea.problem: Academic research project leads struggle to clearly define, allocate, and negotiate collaborator roles, responsibilities, and contribution levels in multi-institutional grant proposals, leading to ambiguity in authorship order, effort distribution, and potential conflicts during proposal development.
inputs: Preliminary task lists or work packages
Institutional policies on authorship and contribution
outputs: Structured, role-based collaboration plan mapping tasks to collaborators
Suggested authorship order based on contribution metrics
Contribution statements aligned with funder and institutional expectations
Conflict or overlap flags with recommendations for resolution
Negotiation summary report with customizable scenarios
whyItWins: Fills a unique gap between high-level project planning and detailed grant writing by focusing on collaboration roles and contributions
Supports repeated iterative negotiation cycles with collaborators and institutions
Goes beyond existing collaboration network visualizers by producing actionable, funder-compliant contribution documentation
Lightweight start with simple inputs and outputs but natural upgrade path to comprehensive collaboration management system
Reduces conflict risk and increases clarity in multi-institutional grant applications, which is a known pain point

upgradePath.today: Single-page tool to input collaborator info, project tasks, and generate role allocation and contribution summaries with basic conflict detection
upgradePath.in90Days: Multi-user collaboration platform with version control, comment threads, and integration of institutional authorship policies to refine role assignments and authorship order interactively
upgradePath.in12Months: Full-featured multi-page grant collaboration management system including timeline tracking, effort reporting, automated funder compliance checks, and exportable customizable contribution statements for all collaborators

riskNotes: Sensitive data about collaborator contributions requires secure handling and access controls
Must carefully respect institutional and funder policies to avoid misattribution or conflicts
Recommendations should be advisory, not prescriptive, to avoid enforcing disputed authorship decisions
Avoid legal or ethical advice; focus on structured documentation and clarity facilitation

blueprint.summary: A collaboration role and contribution optimizer tool for academic research project leads to plan, negotiate, and document multi-institutional grant proposal roles, responsibilities, and authorship order with conflict detection and funder-compliant outputs.
blueprint.primaryUser: Academic research project leads managing multi-institutional grant proposals
successMetrics: Reduction in collaborator role ambiguity and conflicts during grant proposal development
User adoption rate and frequency of iterative negotiation cycles
Accuracy and completeness of generated contribution statements and authorship orders
User satisfaction with clarity and usability of collaboration plans
Number of exported funder-compliant documentation reports

components.name: Collaborator Input UI
components.responsibility: Allow users to input and edit collaborator profiles, CV snippets, and institutional policies relevant to authorship and contributions.
notes: Must support secure handling of sensitive collaborator data
Input validation to ensure completeness and consistency

components.name: Project Task Input UI
components.responsibility: Enable input and editing of project scope, objectives, preliminary task lists, and draft contribution estimates.
notes: Support bulk import (e.g., from documents) as future enhancement

components.name: Collaboration Plan & Summary UI
components.responsibility: Display structured role-based collaboration plans, suggested authorship orders, contribution statements, conflict flags, and negotiation summaries.
notes: Interactive visualization for role allocation and conflict resolution

components.name: Collaborator Management API
components.responsibility: Handle CRUD operations for collaborator profiles, CV snippets, and institutional authorship policies.
notes: Enforce access control and data privacy

components.name: Project Task Management API
components.responsibility: Manage project scope, objectives, task lists, and contribution estimates CRUD operations.

components.name: Collaboration Plan & Analysis API
components.responsibility: Generate and update structured collaboration plans, calculate suggested authorship order, detect conflicts/overlaps, and produce negotiation summaries.
notes: Algorithms must be advisory, not prescriptive
Detect and flag conflicting role assignments or contribution overlaps

components.name: Collaborator Data Store
components.responsibility: Persist collaborator profiles, CV snippets, and institutional authorship policies securely.
notes: Sensitive data requires encryption at rest and access controls
Support versioning for collaborator profile updates

components.name: Project Task Data Store
components.responsibility: Persist project scope, objectives, task lists, and contribution estimates.
notes: Maintain history of task and estimate changes

components.name: Collaboration Plan Data Store
components.responsibility: Store structured collaboration plans, authorship orders, conflict flags, and negotiation summaries.
notes: Support multiple versions for iterative negotiation cycles

dataModels.name: Collaborator
dataModels.purpose: Store detailed information about each collaborator including profile, CV snippets, and institutional policies.

dataModels.name: ProjectTask
dataModels.purpose: Represent tasks or work packages within the project scope with assigned collaborators and contribution estimates.

dataModels.name: CollaborationPlan
dataModels.purpose: Capture structured role assignments, authorship order, conflict flags, and negotiation summaries for a grant proposal iteration.

pages.title: Collaborator Profiles
pages.purpose: Input, edit, and review collaborator profiles, CV snippets, and institutional authorship policies.

pages.title: Project Tasks & Contributions
pages.purpose: Input and manage project scope, objectives, task lists, and draft contribution estimates linked to collaborators.

pages.title: Collaboration Plan & Negotiation Summary
pages.purpose: View structured role assignments, suggested authorship order, conflict flags, and negotiation summaries; export funder-compliant reports.

pages.title: User Authentication
pages.purpose: Authenticate users to secure sensitive collaborator and project data.

apiRoutes.purpose: Create or update a collaborator profile.
Retrieve project tasks and contribution estimates.
Create or update a project task.
Generate or update a collaboration plan with role assignments, authorship order, and conflict detection.
apiRoutes.requestShape: { collaboratorIds: string[], taskIds: string[], institutionalPolicies: json }
apiRoutes.responseShape: CollaborationPlan object with conflict flags and negotiation summary

apiRoutes.purpose: Retrieve a specific collaboration plan version.

backgroundJobs.name: ConflictDetectionJob
backgroundJobs.trigger: On collaboration plan generation or update
backgroundJobs.purpose: Analyze role assignments and contribution estimates to detect conflicts or overlaps and flag them for user review.

edgeCases: Collaborators with incomplete or missing CV snippets or institutional policies
Tasks assigned to multiple collaborators with overlapping or conflicting contribution estimates
Multiple iterative negotiation versions with conflicting role assignments
Institutional policies that conflict between collaborators from different institutions
Users attempting unauthorized access to sensitive collaborator or project data
Exporting reports when data is incomplete or conflicts remain unresolved
Handling simultaneous edits by multiple users in future multi-user versions
nonGoals: Providing legal or ethical advice on authorship disputes
Automatically enforcing authorship order or contribution decisions
Replacing full grant writing or project management tools
Handling detailed timeline tracking, effort reporting, or funder compliance beyond contribution statements in the initial version
Supporting anonymous or public user access without authentication

dataFlow: User authenticates via /login page, receives session token for authorized API access.
On /collaborators page, user inputs or edits collaborator profiles, CV snippets, and institutional authorship policies.
Collaborator Input UI sends POST requests to /api/collaborators to create or update collaborator data.
Collaborator Management API validates and persists collaborator data in the Collaborator Data Store with encryption and versioning.
On /tasks page, user inputs project scope, objectives, tasks, and contribution estimates linked to collaborators.
Project Task Input UI sends POST requests to /api/tasks to create or update project tasks.
Project Task Management API validates tasks and contribution estimates, persists data in Project Task Data Store with history tracking.
On /collaboration-plan page, user selects collaboration plan version or triggers generation.

Collaboration Plan & Analysis API receives collaborator IDs, task IDs, and institutional policies, generates structured collaboration plan with role assignments, authorship order, conflict flags, and negotiation summaries.
ConflictDetectionJob runs during plan generation to detect conflicts or overlaps and flags them.
Collaboration Plan API persists collaboration plan versions in Collaboration Plan Data Store, tracking conflict resolution status.
UI displays collaboration plan visualization, conflict flags, negotiation summaries, and allows export of funder-compliant reports.
All API routes enforce user authentication and authorization to protect sensitive data.
validationRules: Collaborator 'id', 'name', and 'institution' are required and non-empty strings.
CV snippets and authorship policies, if provided, must be valid JSON objects conforming to predefined schema.
Institutional policies must follow a validated format to ensure consistency across collaborators.
ProjectTask 'id' and 'title' are required; 'contributionEstimate' must be a non-negative number if provided.
Assigned collaborators in tasks must reference existing collaborator IDs.
Contribution estimates linked to tasks must sum logically without exceeding 100% or predefined total contribution limits.
CollaborationPlan 'version' must be a positive integer and increment sequentially for each new plan.
Role assignments and authorship orders must reference valid collaborator IDs.
Conflict flags must be structured JSON indicating type, involved collaborators, and resolution status.
API requests must include valid authentication tokens; unauthorized requests are rejected.
Input forms enforce required fields and provide user-friendly error messages for invalid or missing data.
errorHandling: API routes return HTTP 401 Unauthorized for unauthenticated or unauthorized access attempts.
Validation failures return HTTP 400 Bad Request with detailed error messages indicating invalid fields.
Server errors return HTTP 500 Internal Server Error with generic messages; sensitive details are logged internally.
Conflict detection flags are included in collaboration plan responses to inform users of issues rather than blocking operations.
UI components display validation errors inline and prevent submission until resolved.
Export operations check for unresolved conflicts or incomplete data and warn users before proceeding.
Concurrent modification conflicts (future multi-user support) return HTTP 409 Conflict with instructions to refresh data.
All error responses follow a consistent JSON structure with 'errorCode', 'message', and optional 'details' fields.
securityNotes: All API routes require user authentication; sessions or tokens must be securely stored and transmitted over HTTPS.
Collaborator data, especially sensitive CV snippets and contact info, must be encrypted at rest in the database.
Access controls restrict data visibility and modification to authorized users only.
Institutional policies and collaborator profiles are versioned to maintain audit trails and rollback capability.
Input validation prevents injection attacks and ensures data integrity.
Exported reports sanitize all data to prevent leakage of sensitive information.
Rate limiting and monitoring should be implemented on API routes to prevent abuse.
Future multi-user concurrency controls must include optimistic locking or similar mechanisms to prevent data races.

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on the /collaborators page
acceptanceTests.when: They input valid collaborator details including name, institution, and optional CV snippets and policies, then submit
acceptanceTests.then: The collaborator profile is saved successfully and retrievable via GET /api/collaborators

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user on the /tasks page
acceptanceTests.when: They create a new project task with title, description, assigned collaborators, and contribution estimate, then submit
acceptanceTests.then: The task is saved and linked collaborators are validated; task is retrievable via GET /api/tasks

acceptanceTests.given: An authenticated user with existing collaborators and tasks
acceptanceTests.when: They request generation of a collaboration plan via POST /api/collaboration-plan/generate with valid collaborator and task IDs
acceptanceTests.then: A collaboration plan version is created with role assignments, authorship order, conflict flags if any, and negotiation summary

acceptanceTests.given: A collaboration plan with detected conflicts
acceptanceTests.when: The user views the plan on /collaboration-plan page
acceptanceTests.then: Conflict flags are clearly displayed, and the user is warned before exporting reports

acceptanceTests.given: An unauthenticated user attempts to access /collaborators or /tasks pages or API routes
acceptanceTests.when: They navigate to these pages or call the APIs
acceptanceTests.then: Access is denied with redirect to /login or HTTP 401 Unauthorized response

acceptanceTests.given: User submits collaborator data with invalid JSON in authorship policies
acceptanceTests.then: The UI shows validation errors and the API returns HTTP 400 with descriptive error message

acceptanceTests.given: User attempts to export a collaboration plan report with unresolved conflicts
acceptanceTests.then: The system warns about unresolved conflicts and requires user confirmation before proceeding

buildOrder: Implement authentication system and /login page with session/token management.
Define Prisma models for Collaborator, ProjectTask, and CollaborationPlan with required fields and indexes.
Develop Collaborator Data Store with encryption and versioning support.
Build Collaborator Management API (/api/collaborators) with validation and access control.
Create Collaborator Input UI (/collaborators) with form validation and API integration.
Develop Project Task Data Store with history tracking.
Build Project Task Management API (/api/tasks) with validation and collaborator linking.
Create Project Task Input UI (/tasks) with form validation and API integration.
Develop Collaboration Plan Data Store supporting multiple versions and conflict tracking.
Implement ConflictDetectionJob triggered on collaboration plan generation or update.
Build Collaboration Plan & Analysis API (/api/collaboration-plan/generate and /api/collaboration-plan/:id) with advisory algorithms and conflict detection.
Create Collaboration Plan & Summary UI (/collaboration-plan) with visualization, conflict flag display, negotiation summaries, and export functionality.
Implement consistent error handling and validation feedback across all APIs and UIs.
Conduct acceptance testing and security review.

prismaModelsToAdd: model Collaborator { id String @id name String institution String cvSnippets Json? authorshipPolicies Json? contactInfo Json? createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt }

model ProjectTask { id String @id title String description String? assignedCollaborators Json? contributionEstimate Float? relatedObjectives String? createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt }

model CollaborationPlan { id String @id version Int roleAssignments Json authorshipOrder Json conflictFlags Json? negotiationSummary String? createdAt DateTime @default(now()) updatedAt DateTime @updatedAt }

nextPrompts.title: Planner: refine requirements
nextPrompts.purpose: Ask for missing constraints, clarify ambiguous inputs, and gather further details to refine the tool requirements.

nextPrompts.title: Architect: finalize pages + data models
nextPrompts.purpose: Establish final page designs, routes, and data models based on refined requirements.

nextPrompts.title: Builder: generate page stubs
nextPrompts.purpose: Create initial page stubs and UI components for the finalized pages with placeholders.

nextPrompts.title: Integrator: wire pages -> API -> DB
nextPrompts.purpose: Plan integration of UI pages with API endpoints and database models ensuring data flow and security.
